name: unstably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not firm or firmly fixed, and is likely to move or change : He remained standing unstably on the upper deck of the bus, looking back at her. The guidelines relate to health care delivery to unstably housed individuals.
More examplesFewer examplesWhy do some countries embrace democracy while others vacillate unstably between democracy and authoritarianism? All of these artworks unstably straddled the old and the new.When the bread is hot, starch granules are unstably held by the gluten network.
